questions.text: A particle moves from the point $(2.0\hat{i}+4.0\hat{j}) m$, at $t = 0$, with an initial velocity $(5.0\hat{i}+4.0\hat{j}) ms^{-1}$. It is acted upon by a constant force which produces a constant acceleration $(4.0\hat{i}+4.0\hat{j}) ms^{-2}$. What is the distance of the particle from the origin at time $2s$?

The radius and height of a cone are measured by a vernier caliper to be $(5.4\pm0.1) \, \text{cm}$ and $(18.6\pm0.2) \, \text{cm}$ respectively. What will be the value of its volume in appropriate significant figures? (Volume $V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h$)
A metal wire is stretched to make it $0.8\%$ longer. The percentage change in its electrical resistance if its volume remains unchanged is

Analyse the given statements.
 $\textbf{Statement I}$: If three forces $\vec{F}_1$, $\vec{F}_2$ and $\vec{F}_3$ are represented by three sides of a triangle and $\vec{F}_1+\vec{F}_2=-\vec{F}_3$, then these three forces are concurrent forces and satisfy the condition for equilibrium.
 $\textbf{Statement II}$: A triangle made up of three forces $\vec{F}_1$, $\vec{F}_2$ and $\vec{F}_3$ as its sides were taken in the same order, satisfies the condition for translatory equilibrium.

options.text: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

questions.text: $$\left(P + \frac{a}{V^2}\right)(V - b) = RT$$ represents the equation of state of specific gases, where P is the pressure, V is the volume, T is the temperature and a, b, R are the constants. The physical quantity, which has dimensional formula as that of $\frac{a}{b}$, will be
Identify the pair of physical quantities that have exactly same dimensions:

For a given  combustion engine the work done by a gas molecule is given by $W = \alpha x^2 kT e^{-\beta x^2}$, where x is the displacement, k is the Boltzmann constant and T is the temperature. If $\alpha$ and $\beta$ are constants, dimensions of $\beta$ will be:

To find the value of acceleration due to gravity $g$ an experiment is performed by using a pendulum of length $\ell$. In this experiment, time for 100 oscillation is measured by using a watch of 1 second least count and the value is 45.0 seconds. The length is measured by using a metre scale of least count 1 mm and the value is 10.0 cm. Calculate the  error in the determination of $g$ :

A drone rises from rest from the ground vertically upwards with a constant acceleration 2g. An object is dropped from the drone when it is at a height h. The magnitude of velocity of the object through which it strikes on the ground

A particle located at $x = 0$ at time $t = 0$, starts moving along the positive $x$-direction with a velocity '$v$' that varies as $v = \alpha\sqrt{x}$. Where '$\alpha$' is a constant. Then the displacement of the particle varies with time as
If an object covers 2/5th of the total distance with $v_1$ speed and 3/5th distance with $v_2$ then average speed is

A block, starting from rest, accelerates at the rate $f$ through a distance $S$, then continues at constant speed for time t and then decelerates at the rate $\frac{f}{2}$ to come to rest. If the total distance traversed is 15S, then

A balloon is rising in air vertically above a point A on the ground. When it is a height $h_1$, a man  standing at a distance $d$ (point B) from A (see figure) sees it at an angle $45°$ with respect to the vertical. When the balloon climbs up a further height $h_2$, it is seen at an angle $60°$ with respect to the vertical if the man moves further by a distance $2.464d$ (point C). Then the height $h_2$ is (given $\tan 30° = 0.5774$):

A ball (B1) of mass m is thrown vertically upward. Another ball (B2) of mass 2m is thrown at angle $\theta$ with the vertical such that by the time B1 comes to the ground  is at B2 its highest point. The ratio of the heights attained by the two balls respectively is $\frac{1}{x}$. The value of x is __________.

In an javelin throwing event at the Olympics, an participant throws a javelin of mass 1 kg with an initial kinetic energy of 3.2 kJ at an angle $\alpha = 30°$ relative to the horizontal. After a duration of 3 seconds, the javelin inclination with respect to the horizontal axis is denoted as $\beta$. Determine the value of $\beta$, (Assume that javelin is small enough that it directs along slope of trajectory) (given the acceleration due to gravity $g = 10 \ m/s^2$)

A man starts running along a straight road with uniform velocity $\hat{u}=u\hat{i}$ feels that the rain is falling vertically down along $\hat{j}$. If he doubles his speed, he finds that the rain is coming at an angle $\theta$ to the vertical. The velocity of rain with respect to the ground is

A bomb is dropped from an helicopter when it is at a height $h$ directly above the target. If the helicopter is moving horizontally with a speed $v$, the distance by which the bomb will miss the target is given by

A circular particle moving in a circle of radius $R$ with uniform speed takes time $T$ to complete one revolution. If this particle is projected with the same speed at an angle $\theta$ to the horizontal, the maximum height attained by it is equal to $4R$. The angle of projection is then given by:

A ball rolls off the top of a stairway with horizontal velocity $u_0$. The steps are 0.1 m high and 0.1 m wide. The minimum velocity with which that ball just hits the step 5 of the stairway will be $u = \sqrt{x}$ $ms^{-1}$, where x = _____
 [use g = 10 $m/s^2$].

Given below are two statements:
 
 $\textbf{Statement (I)}$: The dimensions of Planck's constant and angular momentum are same.
 
 $\textbf{Statement (II)}$ In Bohr's model electron revolve around the nucleus only in those orbits for which angular momentum is integral multiple of Planck's constant.
 
 In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

options.text: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect

questions.text: In a given screw gauge, there are 100 divisions on the circular scale and the main scale moves by 0.5 mm on a complete rotation of the circular scale. The zero of circular scale lies 6 divisions below the line of graduation when two studs are brought in contact with each other. When a wire is placed between the studs, 4 linear scale divisions are clearly visible while 46th division the circular scale coincide with the reference line. The diameter of the wire is ________ $\times 10^{-2}$ mm.
In an experiment , it is asked to find modulus of elasticity per unit torque applied on the system. The measured quantity has dimension of $[M^a L^b T^c]$. If $b = -3$, the value of $c$ is ________

Two spherical balls having equal masses of negligible radius each are thrown upwards along the same vertical direction at an interval of 3s with the same initial velocity of 35 m/s, then these balls collide at a height of ....... m. (Take $g = 10 \ m/s^2$)

A swimmer wants to cross a river starting from point A to land directly at point B. Line AB makes an angle of 60° with the flow of river. Magnitude of velocity of the swimmer in still water is same as that of the river. The angle $\theta$ with the line AB should be _________ degrees, so that the swimmer reaches point B.

Two men A and B are running along x-axis and y-axis respectively. The position coordinate of  A is given by $x(t) = 20 + 4t - 6t^2$ m. and for  B is given by $y(t) = 10 + 4t^3$ m. At time $t = 1$ sec, If the magnitude of relative velocity of  A w.r.t.  B is $\sqrt{k}$ m/s. Then the value of $k$ is

The minimum wavelength of the given light that can be produced by the photoelectric effect with a photosensitive metal is:
 (Given: The threshold frequency of the metal is $2.0 \times 10^{15}$ $s^{-1}$ and $c = 3.0 \times 10^8$ m/s)

The electron are identified by the quantum numbers 'n' and '$\ell$'
 I. n = 4, $\ell$ = 1
 II. n = 4, $\ell$ = 0
 III. n = 3, $\ell$ = 2
 IV. n = 3, $\ell$ = 1
 
 Can be placed in order of increasing energy as
Match the Column – I with Column – II

options.text: A → P; B→ Q; C→R; D →S
A → P; B → S; C→R; D→Q
A → R; B → Q; C→P; D →S

questions.text:
(A) $M_{(g)} \rightarrow M^-_{(g)}$
 (B) $M_{(g)} \rightarrow M^+_{(g)}$
 (C) $M^+_{(g)} \rightarrow M^{2+}_{(g)}$
 (D) $M^{2+}_{(g)} \rightarrow M^{3+}_{(g)}$
 Minimum and maximum Ionisation Enthalpy would be of:

Consider the following statements.
 $\textbf{A}$ – Magnetic quantum no. gives information about spatial orientation of orbitals
 
 $\textbf{B}$ – Energy of an orbital depends on principal quantum no. for unielectronic species.
 
 $\textbf{C}$ – Spin quantum no. is also obtained from Schrodinger wave equation
 
 The correct statement(s) is/are

The energy required to break one mole of Cl–Cl bonds in $Cl_2$ is 242 kJ $mol^{-1}$. The longest wavelength of light capable of breaking a single CI–Cl bond is
 (c = $3\times 10^8$ $ms^{-1}$ and $N_A$ = $6.02\times 10^{23}$ $mol^{-1}$)

A sample of 3 gram (92% pure) of silver carbonate on being strongly heated yields a residue and gaseous products. Find the volume of evolved gases at STP.
 (Given, molar mass of Ag = 108 g/mol)
The total number of neutrons present in 36 g of water is:

50 mL of a solution of $Na_2CO_3$ neutralizes 49.35 mL of 4 N HCl. The reaction is represented as$$CO_3^{2-} + 2H^+ \rightarrow CO_2 + H_2O$$The density of this $Na_2CO_3$ solution is 1.25 g mL$^{-1}$.
 The percentage of $Na_2CO_3$ in it is:

For the reaction, $$2Fe(NO_3)_3 + 3Na_2CO_3 \rightarrow Fe_2(CO_3)_3 + 6NaNO_3$$Initially if 2.5 mole of $Fe(NO_3)_3$ and 3.6 mole of $Na_2CO_3$ is taken. If 6.3 mole of $NaNO_3$ is obtained then % yield of given reaction is
A given sample of oxygen gas (only $O_2$ molecules) contains $O^{16}$ and $O^{17}$ oxygen atoms only in 9 : 1 atomic ratio. The average molecular mass of $O_2$ in this sample is:

Myoglobin stores oxygen for metabolic process in muscle. Chemical analysis shows that it contains 0.32% Fe(iron) by mass. If there is one Fe atom per molecule of myoglobin, what is the molar mass of myoglobin?
 [At. Mass of Fe = 56u]

In following chemical reaction by taking 159 g of $Cu_2S$, how much gram of $SO_3$ produced?
 (At. mass of Cu = 63.5, S =32, O =16 g/mole)
 $$(i) Cu_2S + O_2 \rightarrow Cu_2O + SO_2$$$$(ii) 2SO_2 + O_2 \rightarrow 2SO_3$$

Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R:
 
 $\textbf{Assertion A}$: Equivalent weight of $NH_3$ in the reaction $N_2 \rightarrow NH_3$ is 17/3 while that of $N_2$ is 28/6.
 
 $\textbf{Reason R}$: Equivalent weight = $\frac{\text{Molecular weight}}{\text{Mole of e}^- \text{ lost or gained by 1 mole species}}$
 
 In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: A is true but R is false.
A is false but R is true.
Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.

questions.text:
How many H-atoms are present in 0.046 g of ethanol ($CH_3CH_2OH$)?
 (Molar mass of ethanol = 46 g/mol)

Given below are two statements:
 
 $\textbf{Statement (I)}$: When 2 moles of $BaCl_2$ react with 3 moles of $Na_3PO_4$, 0.66 mole of $Ba_3(PO_4)_2$ are produced.
 
 $\textbf{Statement (II)}$: $BaCl_2$ is the limiting reactant and some $Na_3PO_4$ remains unreacted.
 
 In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

options.text: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.

questions.text:
25 mL of potassium bromide solution gave 4.70 g silver bromide when treated with excess of silver nitrate solution. The molarity of the potassium bromide solution is ________ M.
 (Given: $\text{K} = 39$, $\text{Br} = 80$, $\text{Ag} = 108$, $\text{N} = 14$, $\text{O} = 16 \, \text{g mol}^{-1}$)

Concentrated sulfuric acid is labelled as 80% by mass. The volume in mL of the solution which contains 48 g of sulfuric acid is ________ mL.
 (Given: Density of sulfuric acid solution is 1.5 g/mL)

$0.02$ cm thick coating of gold is deposited on a plate of $0.08$ m$^2$ area. The number of gold atoms deposited on plate are _______ $\times 10^{23}$. ( Round off to the nearest integer.)
 (At mass $\text{Au} = 197$, $d = 19.3$ g cm$^{-3}$).

The density of x M solution (x molar) of $\text{KOH}$ is $1.045$ g mL$^{-1}$, while in molality, the concentration of the solution is $2$ m ($2$ molal). Then x is _______ M.( Round off to the nearest integer.)
 (Given: Molar mass of $\text{KOH}$ is $56$ g/mol).
The value of azimuthal quantum number of the outermost electron of $Zn^+$ ion is _________.

The frequency of radiation emitted when an electron falls from $n = 4$ to $n = 1$ state in a hydrogen atom is $x \times 10^{15} \ s^{-1}$, the value of $x$ will be_____.(Nearest integer)
 (Given: Ionization energy of hydrogen atom is $2.18 \times 10^{-18} \ J \ atom^{-1}$ and $h = 6.625 \times 10^{-34} \ Js$)

In order to prepare 50 mL of an aqueous solution with 140 mg of $Na^+$ per mL, the amount (in g) of $NaNO_3$ required is_______. (Rounded off to the nearest integer) 
 [Given: At mass: Na = 23, N = 14, O = 16]

3.36 g of dibromide ($MBr_2$) of an element M, is completely converted to 1.58 g of dichloride ($MCl_2$).$$MBr_2 + Cl_2 \rightarrow MCl_2 + Br_2$$.
 The molar mass of M is ____ g/mol
 [Cl: 35.5 g/mol; Br: 80 g/mol]

200 g of propane is completely reacted with 2000 g of oxygen. The mole fraction of water molecules formed in the resulting mixture is x ×10$^{-2}$. The value of x is _______. (Nearest integer)
 [Atomic weight: H=1.008; C=12.00; O = 16.00]
